1.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a conditional particle; if; by implication (interj. as a wish) would that!
to rend, literally or figuratively (revile, paint the eyes, as if enlarging them)
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
to shake (as in the wind), i.e. to quake; figuratively, to be loose morally, worthless or prodigal

2.brief: water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
to gush over, i.e. to swell; (figuratively) to desire earnestly; by implication to ask

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to quiver (with any violent emotion, especially anger or fear)

3.brief: to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to bind together (perhaps by twisting), i.e. collect; (figuratively) to expect

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
to shake (as in the wind), i.e. to quake; figuratively, to be loose morally, worthless or prodigal

4.brief: properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to broaden out the ear (with the hand), i.e. (by implication) to listen
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
probably scattering, i.e. removal; used adverbially, except
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
properly, to adhere to; hence, to await

5.brief: to impinge, by accident or violence, or (figuratively) by importunity
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to crack off, i.e. (figuratively) burst out in rage
properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

6.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a covering, i.e. clothing; also treachery or pillage
the menstrual flux (as periodical); by implication (in plural) soiling
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
to wilt; generally, to fall away, fail, faint; figuratively, to be foolish or (morally) wicked; causatively, to despise, disgrace
a leaf (as coming up on a tree); collectively, foliage
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative

7.brief: a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
to fasten upon; hence, to seize, be strong (figuratively, courageous, causatively strengthen, cure, help, repair, fortify), obstinate; to bind, restrain, conquer
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to melt, i.e. literally (to soften, flow down, disappear), or figuratively (to fear, faint)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),

8.brief: at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
properly, a bubbling up, i.e. of water, a wave; of earth, mire or clay (cement); also a heap; hence, a chomer or dry measure
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to mould into a form; especially as apotter; figuratively, to determine (i.e. form a resolution)
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

to crack off, i.e. (figuratively) burst out in rage
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, vehemence, i.e. (with or without preposition) vehemently; by implication, wholly, speedily, etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care
'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

10.brief: a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem

to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
ornament (abstractly or concretely, literally or figuratively)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.

to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

delightful; hence, a delight, i.e. object of affection or desire
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, drought, i.e. (by implication) a desolation

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
